title: Purpose and Vision
description: Defining your purpose and vision clarifies the compelling reason for undertaking this initiative and provides a shared focus for the work that follows. Having a clear pupose and vision is necessary for alignment between all initiative components.

sections.title: Start with Your Why
sections.description: We have clearly defined a purpose and vision that includes the perspectives of critical stakeholders and articulates the compelling reason for undertaking this initiative.

responses.question: What is our compelling reason to undertake this initiative? What are the drivers?
subquestions: What research and evidence can we use to identify our purpose and vision? What data can help us identify drivers?
What perspectives need to be a part of defining our purpose and vision? What critical conversations can help identify drivers?
Which stakeholders need to be included in this work?

responses.question: What roles do personalized, competency-based learning and blended learning play in achieving our purpose and vision? What purpose does blended learning serve in relation to personalized, competency-based learning?
What are the benefits of taking action? What are the risks of not taking action?
What will be the ultimate impact?
subquestions: Who will be impacted, and how?
What is the impact for the district?

responses.question: How does the vision and mission of this initiative align with the broader work of our district?

assessment.question: Our rationale for undertaking this initiative is clearly articulated.
We understand and have communicated the drivers for this initative.
The relationships between personalized, competency-based learning and blended learning have been defined.
The impact of implementation is clear to all stakeholders.
This initiative is aligned with the strategic plan of our district.

resources.title: The Hexagon: An Exploration Tool Hexagon Discussion & Analysis Tool Instructions (National Implementation Research Network)
resources.description: This tool is most commonly used in the exploration stage to evaluate the fit and feasibility of implementing programs or practices in a given context.  It includes the tool, guidance and instructions for team use, and guiding questions.

resources.title: Management and Operations of Online Programs (Aurora Institute)
resources.description: As part of the Promising Practices in Online Learning series, page 24 of this resource includes a checklist for prioritizing drivers related to online learning environments. Many of these are also relevant for blended learning.

resources.title: The Shifting Paradigm of Teaching: Personalized Learning According to Teachers (KnowledgeWorks)
resources.description: As districts shift to personalize learning for students, this resource provides insight into how that shift impacts teachers as well as district policies and practices related to curriculum, instruction, assessment, learning environments, professional learning, technology, data, and partnerships.

resources.title: Levers and Logic Models: A Framework to Guide Research and Design of High-Quality Competency-Based Education Systems (Aurora Institute)
resources.description: Use logic model frameworks to convey relationships between essential levers (outcomes, drivers and mediating factors) that inform the design of competency-based education systems and critical components of competency-based practice at four interdependent levels (student experience, professional practice of educators, district and school systems and culture).

resources.title: Six Tips for Engaging Your Community in the Visioning Process (KnowledgeWorks)
resources.description: This article speaks to strategies for involving a broad group of stakeholders, including neighbors, business owners, community developers, higher education partners, elected officials and parents in creating a vision for personalized learning.

sections.title: Consensus
sections.description: We understand the steps we must take to ensure that stakeholders have a common understanding and shared purpose and vision.

responses.question: How will we develop a culture that empowers stakeholders to engage in personalized, competency-based learning?
subquestions: What underlying assumptions need to be addressed?
How can we identify and address beliefs, perceptions, biases, and mindsets brought to this work that may not align with implementation?

responses.question: How will we ensure stakeholders:
subquestions: • are aware of "the Why" -- of the drivers, opportunities, and goals for this initiative?
• see value in the change?
• are heard?
• know what success looks like?
• understand their roles are and how this will impact their work?
• know that leadership is commited to the efforts?
• view school and district leaders as a resource for removing/overcoming barriers?

responses.question: What are key terms and definitions for the initiative? What common definitions do we need to develop?
subquestions: How do we define personalized, competency-based learning?
How do we define blended learning?

assessment.question: We have idenitified and addressed the beliefs, perceptions, biases, and mindsets related to this work.
We have co-created and communicted the drivers, opportunities, and goals for personalized, competency-based learning.
We have developed a common language around core concepts.

resources.title: Change Management for the Digital Leap (CoSN)
resources.description: Engage in strategies that go beyond Project Management and focus on Culture Management including a focus on barriers to change, operationalizing your "why", iterating toward success, and making the change.

sections.title: Skills
sections.description: We have identified the expertise and knowledge needed to successfully implement the initiative and ways to address potential gaps in expertise.

responses.question: What expertise and knowledge are beneficial for planning and implementation efforts?
Are there potential gaps in team expertise? If so, how will we fill those gaps?

assessment.question: We have identified the expertise and knowledge needed for successful implementation.
We have identified potential gaps in expertise and strategies for addressing the gaps.

resources.title: Engagement/Re-engagement of Stakeholders
Knowing the "Why": How do leaders communicate with new teachers around the purpose and vision of their innovative models? (The Learning Accelerator)
resources.description: Connecting the "why" to professional learning can provide the contextual understanding to move the work forward.

sections.title: Resources
sections.description: We have identified the resources needed to successfully implement the initiative and ways to address areas where we lack necessary resources.

responses.question: What resources are needed to successfully achieve the purpose and vision?
Are there areas where we need resources? If so, how will we fill those gaps?

assessment.question: We have the resources needed, or are able to access the resources needed, to achieve our vision.

sections.title: Action Plan
sections.description: We have developed a clear action plan that identifies the steps and stakeholder input needed for achieving our goals/objectives and the criteria for evaluating success.

responses.question: What is the mission of this initiative?
What are the goals and objectives of this initiative? What do we plan to achieve?
What steps do we need to take to ensure that the initiative will result in an implementation:
subquestions: • that successfully provides personalized, competency-based learning?
• that effectively uses blended learning to deliver this learning?
• that is consistent with the initiative's purpose and vision?

responses.question: What are the criteria we will use to measure successful acheivement of goals and objectives?
What framework(s) will be used in the planning process?
Which critical stakeholder groups need to be represented in different stages of the planning effort?
How can we use previous/current programs/initiatives to inform our planning?
subquestions: Does this initiative align/connect with any current programs/initiatives?
What are key takeaways from previous initiatives that will inform the planning process?

responses.question: What relevant research and evidence will inform initiative planning and decision-making (e.g., research to guide data review, case studies, district evidence)?
subquestions: What evidence and/or research do we still need to inform planning? How will we gather this data?

responses.question: What is our capacity to undertake this initiative? Will we need to shift priorities/resources to make time to plan and implement this initiative?

assessment.question: The mission of this initiative have been defined and communicated.
We have co-created and communicated the goals and objectives of this initiative.
An action plan for implementation including milestones and deliverables has been developed.
We have defined how we will measure success.
We have determined the critical stakeholder groups who will be involved in the implementation plan.
We have shifted priorities and resources to ensure we have the capacity to implement this initiative.

resources.title: A Guide for Starting and Growing a Digital Learning Program (Digital Learning Collaborative)
resources.description: When planning and launching a blended, online, or digital learning program, this roadmap serves as a guide for implementation.

resources.title: The Annual Report of the Digital Learning Collaborative: Snapshot 2020 - A review of K-12 online, blended, and digital learning
CO: 2020-2021 Instructional Guidance for Diverse Learning Settings
Instructional Design Principles for Remote Teaching and Learning
Establishing or Reviewing a Decision-Making Process
Tool for Performing a SWOT Analysis
Collaborating with Stakeholders
resources.description: Guiding questions for identifying key stakeholders

resources.title: Crowdsourced Data Supporting Student-Centered Learning

title: Logistics & Alignment
description: Ensuring the logistics align with the vision and purpose will support the success of the initiative.

responses.question: What priorities will guide our budgeting decisions?
How will specific budget needs be identified?
What outside funding, if any, will be necessary?

assessment.question: We have defined our budget priorities and determined funding sources for implementation.

responses.question: How will enrollment and scheduling be managed in the SIS?
How will student readiness be assessed and what supports will be in place for identified challenges?

assessment.question: We have defined how enrollment and scheduling will be managed in the SIS.
We have determined strategies to assess student readiness and supports that will be in place as needed.

responses.question: What teacher selection process/indicators will be used?
What supports are needed for teachers in the first year?
What coaching and instructional support structures will be provided to encourage and empower teachers to leverage their strengths and grow professionally?
subquestions: What tool/rubric will be used for teachers and administrators to identify "look-fors" during learning walks?
What feedback protocol will be use to support growth?
What opportunities will be provided for peer observations?

assessment.question: The teacher selection process is clearly defined.
Supports needed for teachers in their first year have been articulated and clearly communicated.
Coaching and instructional support structures will be provided to encourage and empower teachers to leverage their strengths and grow professionally.

responses.question: What professional learning is needed for school and district leaders?
What professional learning will take place for teachers who are new to personalized, competency-based and/or blended learning environments? For more experienced teachers?
Who is developing and facilitating professional learning?
How can teachers self-assess readiness for teaching in a competency-based, personalized, blended learning environment?  How can this information be used to inform professional learning needs?
What training and support will be provided to parents/guardians, counselors, and others to best support learners?
What professional learning is needed to develop knowledge and understanding of related standards?

assessment.question: A professional learning plan for school and district leaders as well as support staff is in place.
A flexible and individualized professional learning plan in in place for teachers.
Teachers are able to self-assess their readiness for teaching in a competency-based, personalized, blended learning environment.

responses.question: How will instructional content/resources, including digital teaching and learning tools and resources be selected?
What instructional content/resources are currently available that would be beneficial to this learning environment?
Do we plan to develop content within our district? If so, what content, when, and who will be responsible?
How will we ensure educational materials are accessible to all learners?
How will open education resources (OER) utilized?
How can we leverage external partnerships and collaboration with other districts to aquire instructional content and resources?
What is the course adoption timeline and process?
What learning management system will be used?
When synchronous instruction takes place, what video conferencing tool will be used?
What training and resources will be provided for teachers and parents to ensure student safety and security?

assessment.question: A process is in place for selecting instructional content/resources, including digital teaching and learning tools.
A learning management system or other content management and delivery tool will be used.
A video conferencing tool is in place for synchronous learning experiences.
Training and resources are in place to ensure student safety and security online.

responses.question: How is technology support provided for families?
How is technology support provided for students?
How is technology support provided for teachers?
How do we ensure the environment and instructional materials are accessible to all students?

assessment.question: Technology support is in place for students, teachers, and families.
Environmental and instructional materials are accessible to all students.

responses.question: Who are the stakeholders, and how will they be empowered contributors to the learning community?
What key messages need to be communicated and when?
What branding will the intiative have?
What orientation opportunities will be provided for students and families?
How is failure celebrated as an interative process of learning? How is reflective practice supported and encouraged?
How will communication strategies be leveraged to build partnerships?
What are the expectations for teacher communication with students and families (i.e. frequency, content)?
What communication methods and channels will be utilized?
What strategies will be used for marketing?
How will information FAQs, tutorials, and documents be organized for stakeholders to find and access easily (internally and externally)?
How do we seek and ensure that we collect feedback from all stakeholders?
What is the process for communicating data and survey results with stakeholders?
What processes will be established for high impact family and community engagement?

assessment.question: Orientation opportunities are in place for students and families.
Failure is celebrated as an interative process of learning with reflective practice supported and encouraged.
Communication strategies are leveraged to build partnerships.
Communication methods and channels have been determined.
FAQs, tutorials, and documents are organized for stakeholders to find and access easily (internally and externally).
Processes are established for high impact family and community engagement.

resources.title: Multiple Access Points for Tech Support
Developing a Communications Plan
Communications and Engagement Workbook
Sustaining Family Engagement in the Formative Assessment Process: Assessment of Teachers’ Professional Learning Needs

responses.question: What district and/or state policies impact this initiative?
What district and state policies provide flexibility for innovative practices?
What district policies need revision or need to be developed? (e.g. acceptable use, academic integrity, attendance/seat time, grading, copyright/intellectual property)
What common knowledge and understanding will be critical to inform policy decisions?

assessment.question: The district and/or state policies that impact this initiative are aligned with the work or are in the revision process.

resources.title: Determining Attendance and Alternatives to Seat-Time

title: Learning Model Redesign
description: Personalized, competency-based learning in a blended learning environment

responses.question: What is the structure of the learning environment (time and place; remote/hybrid/blended)?
What grade level(s) will be served?
Who is the project manager for this intiative? (if applicable)
What courses will be offered and how is that determination made?
What is the initial scope of the initiative (i.e. pilot or district wide)?
How will this learning model impact teacher and student roles? Considerations may include course pace, schedule for students and/or teachers, standards-based grading, etc.

assessment.question: The structure of the learning environment has been defined.
The grade levels that will be served have been determined.
The project manager for this initiative has been defined.
The range of courses that will be included have been determined.
We have defined the initial scope of the initiative (i.e. pilot or district wide).

The structural and learning model implications including areas such as course pace, schedule for students and/or teachers, standards-based grading, student and teacher roles, etc. have been determined.
A clear definition of success has been communicated to all stakeholders.

resources.title: Instructional Strategies for Virtual Learning: A Companion Tool to the NIET Teaching Standards Rubric (National Institute for Excellence in Teaching)
resources.description: Indicators for planning and delivering virtual learning in asynchronous and synchronous learning environments.

resources.title: A Guide for Starting and Growing a Digital Learning Program (Digital Learning Collaborative)
resources.description: When planning and launching a blended, online, or digital learning program, this roadmap serves as a guide for implementation.

resources.title: The Annual Report of the Digital Learning Collaborative: Snapshot 2020 - A review of K-12 online, blended, and digital learning
resources.description: Digital Learning Collaborative report; Includes visual for the spectrum of defining dimensions of an online program- p.4 (e.g. comprehensiveness, reach, type, delivery); Includes sections for various structures of online/blended learning environments; Each section includes related info; Definition, level of engagement, time and space, student demographics, and case studies

responses.question: How will student support services be provided?
How will social and emotional learning be addressed?
How will special populations be served?

assessment.question: We have determined how enrollment and scheduling will be managed within our Student Information System (SIS).
An implementation plan to ensure student support services will be provided is in place.
An implementation plan for supporting social and emotional learning is in place.
Structures and supports are in place to ensure that the needs of individual students are met.

resources.title: Student Support Strategies
MENTOR FUNDAMENTALS A GUIDE TO MENTORING ONLINE LEARNERS
Relationship Mapping Strategy
Educating All Learners: Resource Library

responses.question: What knowledge, skills, and dispositions will support post-secondary success for all learners?
Will instructional delivery be synchronous, asynchronous, or a combination?
What instructional strategies will be implementated to meet the needs of diverse learners?
How will we define and measure student engagement? Self-direction?
How will teachers personalize learning in virtual instruction?

assessment.question: We have defined the knowledge, skills, and dispositions that will support post-secondary success for all learners.
The balance and structure for synchronous and asynchronous instruction has been determined.
We have determined how we will define and measure student engagement.
We have defined strategies for teachers to personalize learning in virtual instruction.

resources.title: Teacher Guide to Online Learning
Staff: Ensure staff have a clear understanding of expectations and feel supported by leadership
Instructional Strategies for Virtual Learning: A Companion Tool to the NIET Teaching Standards Rubric What effective teaching looks and sounds like in a virtual setting
Instructional Guidance for Diverse Learning Settings (Colorado Department of Education)
Instructional Design Principles for Remote Teaching and Learning
How to Choose Words That Motivate Students During Online Learning
Course Evaluation Checklist v2.0 - Template
2020-2021 Instructional Guidance for Diverse Learning Settings (Colorado Dept. of Education)
Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
Utah's High Quality Instructional (HQI) Cycle
Nurturing a Classroom Community During Distance Learning
How Can Educators Tap Into Research to Increase Engagement During Remote Learning?
Distance Learning MTSS Framework: Academic Engagement and Attendance

responses.question: What devices will students use and how will that determination be made? Will devices be provided by the district? Is there a sufficient budget for maintaining, repairing, refreshing, and replacing devices?
How will the devices be managed? How will we ensure sufficient infrastructure and filtering for devices on and off campus? What is our policy for sending devices home with students?
How will we collect information about student home connectivity and access to a device?
What strategies will be in place to support students who lack high-speed internet access?
Do we plan to use mobile devices? How will this decision impact tools and resources selected?
What assistive technology devices, software, and tools are needed and how will they be procured?
How will the Technology team be involved in planning and implementation?

assessment.question: We have determined the devices will students use and have ensured there a sufficient budget for maintaining, repairing, refreshing, and replacing devices.
We have the infrastructure in place to manage devices on and off campus.
We are able to ensure that every student has broadband internet access at school as well as at home.
Assistive technology devices, software, and tools will they be procured to support the needs of individual students.
There are structures in place for departments to collaborate on device and access needs.

responses.question: What policies, processes, and requirements impact hardware and software purchasing decisions and procurement?
What quality indicators inform the selection of effective tools and resources?
What digital tools and resources are currently available to teachers? Students?
How do we determine needs for digital tools and resources?
What considerations have been made for AI and keeping unintentional bias in check (equity)?

assessment.question: The policies, processes, and requirements that impact hardware and software purchasing decisions, including procurement, are clear.
There are quality indicators in place to inform the selection of effective tools and resources.
The digital tools and resources currently available to teachers and students support personalized learning.
A strategy for determining needs for digital tools and resources is in place.
A plan is in place for understanding AI and keeping unintentional bias in check.
Our learning management system (LMS) is in place.
Training and resources are provided for students, teachers, and families to ensure student safety and security.

responses.question: How are students empowered daily to make important decisions about their learning experiences, how they will create and apply knowledge, and how they will demonstrate their learning? (student voice and choice)
In what ways will meaningful and timely feedback be incorporated into learning experiences?
How is assessment a meaningful, positive, and empowering learning experience for students that yields timely, relevant, and actionable evidence?
subquestions: What methods are used to regularly monitor student progress toward mastery, through multiple means and tools, to inform instructional planning?
How is feedback for students prioritized as a key piece in empowering learning?

responses.question: How do students receive timely, differentiated support based on their individual learning needs?
subquestions: What online and offline systems are being leveraged for tracking, planning, and delivering student supports that address gaps and needs?

responses.question: How do students progress based on evidence of mastery, not seat time?
How do students learn actively using different pathways and varied pacing?
What strategies ensure equity for all students? How are they embedded in the culture, structure, and pedagogy of school and education systems?
How are rigorous, common expectations for learning (knowledge, skills, and dispositions) explicit, transparent, measurable, and transferable?
How do you create and disseminate clear expectations for effective remote planning and instruction that integrates research-informed practice?

How do instructional strategies integrate routines that maximize connection and personalization and support a variety of learning needs (e.g., supports for students who are emerging multilinguals, receiving special education services, advanced learners, etc.) and actively engage students in rigorous learning?

assessment.question: Students are empowered daily to make important decisions about their learning experiences, how they will create and apply knowledge, and how they will demonstrate their learning, emphasizing student voice and choice.
Meaningful and timely feedback is incorporated into learning experiences.
Assessment is meaningful, positive, and empowering learning experience for students that yields timely, relevant, and actionable evidence.
Feedback for students is prioritized as a key piece of empowering learning.
Students receive timely, differentiated support based on their individual learning needs.
Various systems are being leveraged for tracking, planning, and delivering student supports that address gaps and needs.
Student progress is based on evidence of mastery, not seat time.
Students learn actively using different pathways and varied pacing.
Strategies for ensuring equity for all students are embedded in the culture, structure, and pedagogy of school and district systems.
Rigorous, common expectations for learning (knowledge, skills, and dispositions) are explicit, transparent, measurable, and transferable.
Clear expectations have been created and disseminated for effective remote planning and instruction that integrates research-informed practice.

Instructional strategies integrate routines that maximize connection and personalization and support a variety of learning needs (e.g., supports for students who are emerging multilinguals, receiving special education services, advanced learners, etc.) and actively engage students in rigorous learning.

title: Sustainability
description: In order to ensure competency-based, personalized learning not only continues, but continues to improve, teams will need to focus on program reviews aligned with a continuous improvement cycle.

responses.question: What framework(s) will we use for reflection and evaluation? How will we measure, analyze, review, and improve implementation?
What stakeholders will be involved in the evaluation process and how will they be involved?
How often will we reflect and evaluate aspects of this initiative?
How will we ensure the quality and availability of needed data for staff, students, and the community?
What student learning data is available to determine the level of impact of implementation?
How will we measure and align efforts to ensure equity?
What surveys are available to measure student and teacher levels of engagement as new instructional models are implemented?
What will inform your professional learning offerings?
How are we measuring the impact of professional learning on classroom practices?
In what ways will you engage with thought partners and organizations to continue learning and growing?
What process is in place to act on what we learn as part of our reflection and evaluation process?

assessment.question: We have framework(s) in place for reflection and evaluation including how strategies for measuring, analyzing, reviewing, and improving implementation.
We know which stakeholders will be involved in the evaluation process and how will they be involved.
We have access to the data needed for staff, students, and the community.
Student learning data is available to determine the level of impact of implementation.
We are measuring, aligning, and strategically considering efforts and resource needs to ensure equity.
Surveys are available to measure student and teacher levels of engagement as new instructional models are implemented.
We have a professional development plan in place.
We measure the impact of professional learning on classroom practices.
We engage with thought partners and organizations to continue learning and growing.

responses.question: What will be the initiative budget and related expenditures (e.g. funding for infrastructure, devices, content, professional development, human resources)?
What district policies need to be revised or need to be developed? (e.g. attendance/seat time, grading, etc.)
What common knowledge and understanding will be critical to inform policy decisions?

assessment.question: The initiative budget and related expenditures (e.g. funding for infrastructure, devices, content, professional development, human resources) are sustainable.
District policies that need to be revised or need to be developed (e.g. attendance/seat time, grading, etc.) have been identified.
